my first function



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
add<-function(x,y=1){
  x+y
}
```
:::



can i just use this?\



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
add(10,10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 20
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
add(10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 11
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
add(1,1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
add(x=1,y=100)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 101
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
add(c(100,1,100),1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 101   2 101
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
add(10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 11
```


:::
:::



Q;make a function: "generate_DNA()" that makes a random nucleotide sequence of any length



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bases <- c("A", "C", "G", "T")
sequence <- sample(bases, size=5, replace=TRUE)
```
:::



That is my working lines, now i can make it into a function



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
generate_dna<-function(length){
  bases <- c("A", "C", "G", "T")
sequence <- sample(bases, size=length, replace=TRUE)
return(sequence)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
generate_dna(10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "G" "G" "G" "A" "T" "C" "G" "T" "A" "C"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bio3d::aa.table
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
unique(bio3d::aa.table$aa1)[1:20]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "A" "R" "N" "D" "C" "Q" "E" "G" "H" "I" "L" "K" "M" "F" "P" "S" "T" "W" "Y"
[20] "V"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
generate_protein<-function(l){
  aas<-unique(bio3d::aa.table$aa1)[1:20]
  poly <- sample(aas, size=l, replace=TRUE)
  poly<-paste(poly, collapse = "")
  return(poly)
}
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
generate_protein(10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "TPYHCMDPTS"
```


:::
:::



Generate protein sequences of length 6 to 12



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
answer<-sapply(6:12, generate_protein)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cat(paste( ">id.", 6:12, "\n", answer,sep="", "\n"))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
>id.6
NAFPFR
 >id.7
QDGIEPC
 >id.8
CFEQWAWG
 >id.9
RMMEFGYDL
 >id.10
VCAYSEEEYL
 >id.11
PNVEKKFLVWG
 >id.12
DRACSQLHLKQF
```


:::
